com.mesosphere.sdk.state

Class StateStoreCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.state.StateStoreCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateStore

    public class StateStoreCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements StateStore
    Thread-safe caching layer for an underlying StateStore. Writes are automatically forwarded to the underlying instance, while reads prioritize the local instance. In order to maintain consistency, there should only be one StateStoreCache object per process. In practice this works because there should only be one scheduler task/process accessing the state data at any given time. Implementation note: All write operations always invoke the underlying storage before updating the local cache. This avoids creating an inconsistent cache state if writing to the underlying persistent store fails.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static StateStore getInstance(StateStore store)
        Returns a cache instance. To ensure consistency, only one singleton cache instance may exist in the process at a time. This function may be called multiple times, but only if the same StateStore instance is provided each time.

      • storeTasks

        public void storeTasks(java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
                throws StateStoreException
        Description copied from interface: StateStore
        Stores TaskInfo objects representing tasks which are desired by the framework. This must be called before StateStore.storeStatus(TaskStatus) for any given task id, and it must behave as an atomic transaction: On success, everything is written, while on failure nothing is written.
        Specified by:
        storeTasks in interface StateStore
        Parameters:
        tasks - Tasks to be stored, which each meet the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when persisting TaskInfo information fails, or if its TaskId is malformed

      • storeStatus

        public void storeStatus(TaskStatus status)
                 throws StateStoreException
        Description copied from interface: StateStore
        Stores the TaskStatus of a particular Task. The TaskInfo for this exact task MUST have already been written via StateStore.storeTasks(Collection) beforehand. The TaskId must be well-formatted as produced by CommonTaskUtils.toTaskId(String).
        Specified by:
        storeStatus in interface StateStore
        Parameters:
        status - The status to be stored, which meets the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if storing the TaskStatus fails, or if its TaskId is malformed, or if its matching TaskInfo wasn't stored first

                                               throws StateStoreException
        Description copied from interface: StateStore
        Fetches all TaskStatuses from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found. Note that this list may have fewer entries than StateStore.fetchTasks() if some tasks are lacking statuses.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The TaskStatus objects associated with all tasks

        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if the key or value fail validation, or if storing the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        StateStoreUtils.validateKey(String), StateStoreUtils.validateValue(byte[])
